instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B slow charging
threads.message:
Hi there

I have in my posession a 2012 MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B) that has been randomly shutting off while on power and on battery. The battery has been replaced. I have gone through and all the power lines seem good. The only anomaly is that the charger is pulling 18.5V @ 380ma while the machine is powered off and takes approx 12 hours to charge a battery fully. This is a new battery. What could be causing this slow charge?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B slow charging
threads.message:
"This is a new battery"
New chinese battery???
Try an old known good battery...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B slow charging
threads.message: I removed, reinstalled and reconnected the battery and now its charging normally.
